QUINTESSENTIAL.Definition: being the perfect or most typical example of it

ROBBER-BARON.Definition: someone who had become rich through dishonest or unfair practices

SCROLLING.Definition: moving up and down a computer screen

PIONEERS.Definition: people who did it for the first time

STANDARD.Definition: a product that is widely recognised or accepted

TRACED BACK.Definition: found to have been started by

PATENTED.Definition: obtained official licences that allowed him to use them exclusively for a period of time

FLUORESCENT.Definition: producing a very bright light by using electricity

ON PAPER.Definition: in theory rather than in reality

MARGINALISED.Definition: treated as or considered not important

UNDERRATED.Definition: more important than most people believed

OUTSIDER.Definition: a person who was not accepted by or who kept himself away from society

OBSESSIVENESS.Definition: the state of occupying his mind with something too much

OUTSPOKEN.Definition: expressing his opinions openly even if they were likely to shock or offend people

BREAKDOWN.Definition: sudden failure of his mental health, mental illness

GAMBLING AWAY.Definition: losing by playing games of chance

NATURALISED.Definition: admitted or accepted as a US citizen

REFUSED.Definition: said that he would not do it

PAY OUT.Definition: pay (for a large amount of money)

ENOUGH WAS ENOUGH.Definition: that was enough, no more of that would be accepted

TO MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: to earn just enough money to live on

DIGGING.Definition: removing earth in order to make

WAS ONTO SOMETHING.Definition: had discovered or produced something important

PATENTS.Definition: official licences that allowed him to use his inventions exclusively for a period of time

DOMINANT.Definition: having the most control or influence

CAPITAL INTENSIVE.Definition: requiring a lot of money to produce the service

LENDERS.Definition: people that gave him money with the understanding that they would get them back

ROYALTY.Definition: money paid for the use of his patent

BIZARRELY.Definition: in a strange and unusual way

STACK.Definition: lots of them arranged one on top of another

WAS IN THE MOOD FOR.Definition: felt like doing it or wanted to do it

BENEFACTORS.Definition: people who helped him, especially financially

DAPPER.Definition: dressing in a fashionable way or smart

IN OBSCURITY.Definition: in a state of being unknown or considered unimportant

POLITICAL FOOTBALL.Definition: an issue that politicians argued about and tried to use for their advantage

LEGACY.Definition: the things and contributions that he had left after his death

ASHES.Definition: the remains of his body after burning

PERSONAL EFFECTS.Definition: things that he often carried with him

PROMINENCE.Definition: the state of being well-known and important

MISSED OUT.Definition: did not use or have the opportunity to experience
